required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of an Oral Hygiene Implant Protocol
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of an Oral Hygiene Regimen on Implant Supported, Removable Complete Denture: Effect on Gingival Tissue and Prosthesis: A Proof of Concept Study

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to evaluate the effectiveness of cleaning around implants that hold a full denture in the mouth. Different oral hygiene protocols will be compared. Areas to measure are gum tissue color and consistency, bleeding and cleanliness. A questionnaire will be provided at the end of the study. This is a proof of concept study.

detailed_description.textblock: The aim of this proof of concept study is to evaluate the effect of an oral hygiene regimen of manual brushing and water flossing on implant retained removable complete dentures. This is a randomized, two arm clinical trial that will compare the traditional oral hygiene regimen to the experimental regimen. Data will be evaluated at baseline, 3 weeks and 6 weeks. Photographs of the tissue and denture will be taken.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Manual brushing with ADA standard toothpaste
Manual brushing with ADA toothpaste + water flossing

intervention.description: Device that uses water under pressure to clean around teeth and under the gums
intervention.arm_group_label: Manual brushing with ADA standard toothpaste
Manual brushing with ADA toothpaste + water flossing

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- have a maxillary and/or mandibular implant supported, removable complete denture that is supported by at least 2 implants in good, serviceable condition
- Good general health, with no diseases which could impact periodontal health
- able to read and understand English
- willing to return for all appointments
- at least 30% BOP
- probing depths less or equal to 5mm
Exclusion Criteria:
- subjects who are currently pregnant
- mobility of implant
- subjects who have diabetes
- subjects who smoke
- subjects with any serious medical condition which the investigator feels may impact participation in the study
